posts.author: Devlinor
posts.content:
marshall wrote:

One question (and thanks again for helping me out): why would i want extend spell in the OC. It seems to me most buffs that i use will last 1/h/lvl which seems quite decent.

Talking about http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 23838.html right now (and i'm sorry for jumping over from build>build).
Extend spell in the OC serves two purposes. 1. It allows you to extend some of the short term buffs, and also an extended Bulls str at lvl 3 lasts six hours. 2. It allows you to have more of the useful spells available. Say you are in the heat of battle and get hit by a dispell or one of the buff strippers and all your third lvl spells have been used. If you have darkfire in the fourth lvl slot as an extended, you can at least get that up. Same for all your other spells. Many builders use the meta magics (Extend, Maximise, empower, silent, still, quicken) for spell book management. It allows you to cast many different spells and still keep a lot of the buffs going when you need them.

Now to dual wield. If you want a dual wielder, Don't go Halfling unless you are going for exotic and choose Kukri, or choose dagger (without the exotic feat) Halfling monks going with the kama and dual wield feat suffer the same penalty that a normal human would if they chose the dual wield and a pair of long swords. Dagger's and Kukri are the only two weapons that can be effectively used by the halfling folk.

posts.author: Mithril Jack
posts.content:
DP = Divine Power, a 4th level cleric spell. It temporarily makes a cleric fight as a fighter of the equivalent character level. Actually if you can keep your pre-epic BAB at less than 16 (the one less attack you mentioned), you end up fighting better than a fighter. Check out the Wiki for details.


AFAIK you could set up your own server, but I really don't know how. FYI World of Greyhawk is much more difficult than vanilla NWN; not being able to save the game or pause the action is tough to get used to, but once you do it's a lot of fun!

Rounds/caster level, extendable, recastable, scribable. Do you know you can memorize more than one instance of the spell and that metamagic feats can be applied right?

Evidently the 4th natural attacks has its own upsides, but the 4th attack at full BAB vs -15 BAB is just huge. Your natural 4th attack even if there always will miss a lot of times, vs the additional one hitting much more often. If you crunch the numbers you might easily end up with the 4th natural attack dealing less damage output than the magical additional one over a rest cycle, all factors considered.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content: My aim is not to convince you, but to illustrate the benefits of what is a typical building practice for clerics. The final choice is up to you and you might be justified in going for the 4th natural attack. As said the 4th natural attack has its upsides and in the end it has to be you to decide what's best for you. You might want, one day, to try both approaches and see what best suits your playstyle. That's the only way to get your own final answer, the one right for you.
